fields.name: Package
Content
Application
Address
AustralianPostCode
fields.doc: A four digit numeric descriptor for a postal delivery area, aligned with placename, suburb or locality and in some circumstances a unique Postal Delivery Type.

fields.name: AustralianState
fields.doc: The defined State or Territory in Australia (in abbreviated format) that the specific Dealing is registered in

fields.name: Country
fields.doc: The destination country of the address

fields.name: Suburb
fields.doc: The full name of the placename or Post Office of delivery containing the specific address, which may include a Delivery Centre or a Business Centre.

fields.name: Type
fields.doc: Determines if the address is Standard, Non Standard, a DX Box or a PO BOX

fields.name: UniqueID
fields.doc: Unique ID

fields.name: Standard
StreetName
fields.doc: The full street name used to identify the street location of the property.

fields.name: StreetNumber
fields.doc: To record the numeric or numeric/alpha reference number of a house or property.

fields.name: StreetType
fields.doc: Used to identify the thoroughfare type
The standard address.
Any real or postal address, used by reference

fields.name: Household
NumberOfAdults
fields.doc: The number of adults in the household

fields.name: NumberOfDependants
fields.doc: The number of dependants in this applicant household.

fields.name: UniqueID
fields.doc: Unique ID

fields.name: ExpenseDetails
LivingExpense
Amount
fields.doc: The dollar amount of this particular living expense for the household as declared by the applicant.

fields.name: Category
symbols: Body Corporate Fees, Strata Fees and Land Tax on Owner Occupied Principal Place of Residence
Higher Education, Vocational Training and Professional Fees
Investment property utilities, rates and related costs
Owner occupied property utilities, rates and related costs
Public or Government Primary and Secondary Education
Sickness and Personal Accident Insurance, Life Insurance
Telephone, internet, pay TV and media streaming subscriptions
fields.doc: The category that this declared living expense falls under.

fields.name: Frequency
fields.doc: The frequency that corresponds to the declared amount for this particular Living Expense.

fields.name: UniqueID
fields.doc: Unique ID

fields.name: PercentResponsible
Owner
x_Party
fields.doc: Contains a reference to a party that is an owner of the item, or has a similar relationship such as a borrower or beneficiary.
Container that associates a reference to an owner or other responsible party with the percentage of the item that they own or are responsible for.

Where the party responsible for the expense needs to be established at an individual level, this element identifies the party that is responsible for the split and corresponding percentages. Each expense may be owned by one or more parties, typically the applicants, so there may be more than one owner referenced. An expense may also be partially owned by a non applicant, such as an applicant s spouse, in which case the third party owner may be referenced, or less than 100% ownership of the expense may be assigned.
Contains the details of a single line item that forms part of the household s declared living expenses.
The set of expenses declared for the household, including Living Expenses and Other Commitments.
A household to which one or more person applicants belong, used in relation to the calculation of household living expenses

fields.name: Liability
AnnualInterestRate
fields.doc: Captures the annual interest rate that applies to the liability

fields.name: OriginalAmount
fields.doc: Captures the original loan amount, being the credit limit for a line of credit, or the fully drawn principal amount for an amortising loan.

fields.name: OriginalLoanPurpose
fields.doc: Captures the original loan purpose

fields.name: OutstandingBalance
fields.doc: Captures the outstanding, current or unpaid balance of the liability.

fields.name: Type
fields.doc: The type of liability. Types include credit card limits, HECS debt, existing loans, etc.

fields.name: PercentOwned
Owner
x_Party
fields.doc: A reference to a party that is an responsible for the liability.
The details of the ownership of this liability, either as borrower or guarantor.
Identifies the party/s that are responsible for the liability and the amount they are responsible for, either as a borrower or guarantor.

fields.name: RemainingTerm
Duration
fields.doc: The duration of the remaining term.

fields.name: Units
fields.doc: The units used to define the duration of the remaining term.
Container element for capturing the remaining term of liabilities not being refinanced.

fields.name: Repayment
RepaymentAmount
fields.doc: The repayment expense amount associated with repaying this loan

fields.name: RepaymentFrequency
fields.doc: The payment frequency of the repayment associated with this loan
Details of the repayment expense associated with this loan
A liability item is a debt owed to a creditor or lender such as a loan, line of credit, or tax bill.

fields.name: LoanDetails
AmountRequested
fields.doc: Captures the loan amount as requested by the applicant for this loan account, exclusive of to be capitalised fees and/or LMI.

fields.name: LoanType
fields.doc: The type of credit facility.

fields.name: Borrowers
Owner
Percent
fields.doc: Captures the percentage of the item that referenced party owns or is responsible for.

fields.name: x_Party
fields.doc: Contains a reference to a party that is an owner of the item, or has a similar relationship such as a borrower or beneficiary.
Container that associates a reference to an owner or other responsible party with the percentage of the item that they own or are responsible for.
Identifies the parties that are prospective borrowers on this loan account.

fields.name: LendingPurpose
IncludesRefinancing
fields.doc: Whether all or part of this credit facility will be used to refinance in full or in part one or many existing credit facilities.

fields.name: LenderCode
fields.doc: Captures the lender specified code for this purpose for which the loan funds will be used by the applicant.
Details of the purpose for which the applicant intends to use the loan funds.

fields.name: LoanPurpose
PrimaryPurpose
fields.doc: Captures the primary purpose for which the loan funds will be used by the applicant. Categories reflect the categories used in classifying a loan as regulated or unregulated under the NCCP.
Contains information about the main purpose for which the applicant intends to use the loan funds.

fields.name: ProposedRepayment
RegularRepayment
Amount
fields.doc: Preferred or nominated total regular repayment amount (incorporating any GST or Stamp Duty in the case of Equipment Finance Transactions)

fields.name: Frequency
fields.doc: Captures the applicants preferred period for making loan repayments for the loan account. Captured when the loan product selected offers a range of repayment periods, enabling the applicant to nominate a period which best suits their needs in terms of income and the desire to reduce interest over the life of the loan by accelerating the reduction of the principal balance.
Container element for information associated with regular repayments
Contains information that specifies how the borrower(s) intend to make regular or structured repayments.

fields.name: Security
x_Security
fields.doc: Contains a reference to a security (real estate or non real estate asset) that is submitted with the loan application, and information about the relationship between the subject loan account and that security.
Contains a reference to a security property that is submitted with the loan application, and information about the relationship between the subject loan account and that security property.

fields.name: Term
TotalTermDuration
fields.doc: The Duration of the specified loan term, as a multiple of the Units

fields.name: TotalTermUnits
fields.doc: Captures the period described by the number specified for term.

Details of the total term of the credit product and any introductory terms, such as an interest only term (including interest only reasons) or a fixed rate term that applies for an initial period at the start of the product.

Information about an individual credit facility that is being applied for including but not limited to: term loans; revolving credit facilities; overdrafts; credit cards; equipment finance; commercial bills; margin loans; personal loans; and reverse mortgages.

fields.name: NonRealEstateAsset
Transaction
fields.doc: Indicates the current status of the applicants ownership of the property, or the transaction that is proposed by them in relation to the property.

fields.name: Type
fields.doc: Indicates what the type of non real estate asset being described.

fields.name: UniqueID
fields.doc: Unique ID

fields.name: EstimatedValue
EstimateBasis
fields.doc: Indicates whether the estimate was based on the valuation of the applicant or a certified valuer.

fields.name: Value
fields.doc: The estimated current market value of the non real estate asset.
The estimated value of the asset

fields.name: MotorVehicle
Make
fields.doc: Captures the make of the vehicle, such as Holden

fields.name: Model
fields.doc: Captures the model of the vehicle

fields.name: RegistrationNumber
fields.doc: Registration identifier for the asset e.g. license plate number.

fields.name: Year
fields.doc: Captures the year in which the vehicle was first registered or the model year.
Contains information about an asset that is a motor vehicle.

fields.name: PercentOwned
Owner
Percent
fields.doc: Captures the percentage of the item that referenced party owns or is responsible for.

fields.name: x_Party
fields.doc: Contains a reference to a party that is an owner of the item, or has a similar relationship such as a borrower or beneficiary.
Container that associates a reference to an owner or other responsible party with the percentage of the item that they own or are responsible for.

An asset may be owned by one or more parties, typically the applicants, so there may be more than one owner referenced. An asset may also be partially owned by a non applicant, such as an applicant s spouse, in which case the third party owner may be referenced, or less than 100% ownership of the asset may be assigned. If the asset is to be purchased, then this indicates the expected ownership arrangement post settlement

fields.name: FinancialAsset
Type
fields.doc: The type of financial asset
Captures the details of a financial account asset or security e.g. Cash, cash equivalents, and accounts at financial institutions
Contains details about an asset item that is not real estate, such as a term deposit account.

fields.name: PersonApplicant
ApplicantType
fields.doc: Whether the loan party is an borrower or guarantor

fields.name: Citizenship
fields.doc: The country that the person is a citizen of.

fields.name: CountryOfBirth
fields.doc: The country in which this applicant was born.

fields.name: DateOfBirth
fields.doc: Captures the date of birth for the applicant.

fields.name: FirstHomeBuyer
fields.doc: The person should indicate whether they are a first home buyer in accordance with the State Revenue Office s definition of a first home buyer.

fields.name: Gender
fields.doc: Indicates the gender of the applicant.

fields.name: MaritalStatus
fields.doc: The marital status of the applicant should be indicated

fields.name: PrimaryApplicant
fields.doc: Indicates whether the lender should consider the party to be the primary applicant when processing the loan application. The significance of the primary applicant to the application varies from lender to lender.

fields.name: UniqueID
fields.doc: Unique ID

fields.name: x_Household
fields.doc: Links to a Household element

fields.name: Contact
CurrentAddress
HousingStatus
fields.doc: Indicates the housing status of this applicant e.g. Whether they are boarding, renting, own their own home, living with parents, other, etc.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.doc: The date that the applicant moved to the residential address

fields.name: x_ResidentialAddress
fields.doc: Reference to the applicant s current residential address
The current address details for the applicant

Email

Container element for the applicant contact details

fields.name: Employment
SelfEmployed
ANZSCOOccupationCode
fields.doc: The ANZSCO occupation code specifying the person s role or occupation in this employment. This attribute is restricted to the list of ANZSCO occupation codes published by the ABS on 26/03/2013 that superseded the ASCO Occupation Codes, although the superseded codes still remain in common use.

fields.name: Occupation
fields.doc: Text description of the person s role or occupation for this employment

fields.name: x_Employer
fields.doc: The applicant should capture their company details for this instance of self employment.

fields.name: BusinessIncomePrevious
ProfitAfterTax
fields.doc: This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. Captures the profit after tax for the specified financial year.

fields.name: ProfitBeforeTax
fields.doc: This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. Captures the net profit/profit before tax for the specified financial year.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.doc: This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. The start date for the stated income, generally the start of a financial year.

This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. Details of the share of the income or income related amounts in the previous financial year (immediately preceding the most recent full financial year), attributable to this applicant (for year = current year 2).

fields.name: BusinessIncomeRecent
ProfitAfterTax
fields.doc: This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. Captures the profit after tax for the specified financial year.

fields.name: ProfitBeforeTax
fields.doc: This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. Captures the net profit/profit before tax for the specified financial year.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.doc: This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. The start date for the stated income, generally the start of a financial year

This item is now deprecated and will be deleted in a future release. BusinessIncome element must be used instead. Details of the share of the income or income related amounts in the most recent full financial year, attributable to this applicant (year = current year 1).

Self employed refers to people who work for themselves in either wholly owned or part owned organisations, including when operating as a (paid) Director. The organisation may or may not employ other people.
Contains information about the persons current or previous employment.

fields.name: PersonName
fields.doc: The name of the person applicant.

fields.name: RelationshipToPrimaryApplicant
fields.doc: The relationship between this person and the primary applicant (specifically for guarantor).
Contains applicant details where the applicant is a person, being either a borrower or a guarantor, and may be acting for a Trust.

fields.name: RealEstateAsset
Transaction
fields.doc: Indicates the current status of the applicants ownership of the property, or the transaction that is proposed by them in relation to the property.

fields.name: UniqueID
fields.doc: Unique ID

fields.name: EstimatedValue
EstimateBasis
fields.doc: Indicates whether the estimate was based on the valuation of the applicant or a certified valuer.

fields.name: Value
fields.doc: The estimated value of the real estate.

fields.name: EstimateMethodology
fields.doc: The methodology used for estimating the value.
Contains details about the estimated value of the property

fields.name: PercentOwned
x_Party
fields.doc: Contains a reference to a party that is an owner of the item, or has a similar relationship such as a borrower or beneficiary.

An asset may be owned by one or more parties, typically the applicants, so there may be more than one owner referenced. An asset may also be partially owned by a non applicant, such as an applicant s spouse, in which case the third party owner may be referenced, or less than 100% ownership of the asset may be assigned. If the asset is to be purchased, then this indicates the expected ownership arrangement post settlement. If the percentage ownership is not shown, then ownership is assumed to be in equal parts.

fields.name: Occupancy
fields.doc: Indicates who occupies the dwelling on the property. Where the property is being purchased, this is the purchaser s intention as to who will occupy the dwelling after the purchase completes.

fields.name: PrimaryPurpose
fields.doc: Indicates the primary or predominant purpose for which the owners hold the property.

fields.name: x_Address
fields.doc: Address should capture the location details of real estate asset.
Contains information about an asset which is real property.

fields.name: RelatedCompany
ABN
fields.doc: The ABN of the related company

fields.name: BusinessName
fields.doc: The business name or trading name of the company

fields.name: BusinessStructure
fields.doc: Legal structure of this business (only populated where this applicant is a Business Enterprise).

fields.name: UniqueID
fields.doc: Unique ID
A business enterprise (including company, sole trader, partnership, trust, or government department) that is not an applicant but has a role in some aspect of the application.
The set of borrower and broker provided data for a single loan application.
The content of the message.

fields.name: Instructions
ApplicationInstructions
Submit
AssessmentType
fields.doc: Indicates the type of assessment.
Submission information related to the application process.
Submission information or application status updates.
Determines the scope of the message. The message can be about the Application, Valuation, Mortgage Insurance, Loan Documents or an Error.

fields.name: Publisher
LIXICode
fields.doc: The LIXI specified code of the sender/publisher of the Package.

The publisher of the specific XML file, being the party responsible for the content of the file as well as the work instruction, and to whom the response message would be delivered. For a mortgage broker sending an application to a lender, this would likely be the aggregator if they are providing the software, or perhaps the broker company or broker otherwise. For a lender requesting LMI, the lender is the publisher. For the LMI response, the LMI provider is the publisher.

fields.name: Recipient
LIXICode
fields.doc: The LIXI specified code for the licensee that is the intended recipient for the Package.
The intended recipients (company or company specified routing) for the Package from the Publisher.

fields.name: SchemaVersion
LIXITransactionType
fields.doc: Identifies the transaction type of the schema, for example CAL (for a Credit Application) or DAS (for Documents Preparation and Settlement).

fields.name: LIXIVersion
fields.doc: Captures the LIXI version number that the application XML was written to conform with.
Contains information about the package schema version

The root element that contains a message for exchange between two end points involved in the workflow related to the processing of an application for a new financial product or change management of an existing financial product. The message contains instructions to the recipient requesting some workflow activity along with data related to: the applicant and the financial product involved; the publisher; one or more recipients; schema version information; and any related attachments.
